Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining changed country circumstances and absence of compelling reasons for persecution
Credibility_Assessment: Applicants' past persecution acknowledged, but current risk not established
Evidence_Type: Country condition reports, applicants' testimony, lack of psychological evidence
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Improved conditions in Ukraine post-Orange Revolution
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Board's findings
Evidence_Ignored: Psychological evidence did not meet 'atrocious' threshold
Legal_Standard: Ceased protection under s. 108(1)(e) unless compelling reasons under s. 108(4)
Application_Factor: Existence of past persecution, current country conditions
Decision_Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed due to ceased need for protection
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Alleged error in assessing changed circumstances and compelling reasons
Cause_of_Refusal: No compelling reasons for continued persecution despite past events
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of sufficient evidence to establish ongoing risk or 'atrocious' psychological harm
Credibility_Issues: Partial credibility based on outdated risk despite past persecution
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of Boardâ€™s interpretation of changed circumstances
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration matters
